intro: Psychotria poilanei, commonly known as the Madagascar psychotria, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its dark green, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. It produces small, red berries that are toxic to humans and animals. Psychotria poilanei is often found in humid, shaded forest environments.
